page.title: 19An Eyesore or Amenity
page.content: To the south of our area and running from south-east to north-west is a disused railway running through cuttings or on embankments but rarely at ground level. It is often used by walkers in the area since being surrounded by woods and fields it can be very pleasant. Some may say that a dismantled railway line is a potential eyesore but is this always the case? When it was first closed the cuttings provided ideal sites for people who wanted to tip their rubbish. Now most of it is cleaned up and wild plants, birds and animals are taking control. Some plants which have been killed by chemicals used on farms can be found, one example is the poppy. Foxes are here too heading for the woods at night in search of food.
